content: It is not uncommon for guide dogs, which are trained to assist blind and visually impaired individuals, to accompany their owners in public places. While it might be cute to see dogs wearing shoes, it is not a practical solution for addressing pollution in our streets. Guide dogs are trained to assist their owners in navigating their surroundings, and wearing shoes could potentially interfere with their ability to do so. Additionally, there are many other factors that contribute to pollution in our streets, and addressing these issues would require a more comprehensive approach.
